utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So if a photon is directed through a plane with two slits in it and either slit is observed it will not go through both slits. If it’s unobserved it will, however, if it’s observed after it’s left the plane but before it hits its target, it will not have gone through both slits.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Agreed, what’s your point?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s no point, I just think it’s a good idea for a tee-shirt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: Hang on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: One across is Aegean, eight down is Nabakov, twenty-six across is MCM, fourteen down is… move your finger… phylum, which makes fourteen across Port-au-Prince. See, Papa Doc’s capital idea, that’s Port-au-Prince. Haiti.

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes. Um, is this the High IQ sperm bank?

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: If you have to ask, maybe you shouldn’t be here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think this is the place.

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: Fill these out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank-you. We’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: Oh, take your time. I’ll just finish my crossword puzzle. Oh wait.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I don’t think I can do this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What, are you kidding? You’re a semi-pro.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. We are committing genetic fraud. There’s no guarantee that our sperm is going to generate high IQ offspring, think about that. I have a sister with the same basic DNA mix who hostesses at Fuddruckers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, this was your idea. A little extra money to get fractional T1 bandwidth in the apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know, and I do yearn for faster downloads, but there’s some poor woman is going to pin her hopes on my sperm, what if she winds up with a toddler who doesn’t know if he should use an integral or a differential to solve the area under a curve.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sure she’ll still love him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, what do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want to leave.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s the protocol for leaving?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, I’ve never reneged on a proffer of sperm before.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s try just walking out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bye-bye

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you still mad about the sperm bank?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You want to hear an interesting thing about stairs?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If the height of a single step is off by as little as two millimetres, most people will trip.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t care. Two millimetres? That doesn’t seem right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s true, I did a series of experiments when I was twelve, my father broke his clavicle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is that why they sent you to boarding school?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, that was the result of my work with lasers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: New neighbour?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Evidently.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Significant improvement over the old neighbour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Two hundred pound transvestite with a skin condition, yes she is.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hi!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We don’t mean to interrupt, we live across the hall.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh… uh… no… we don’t live together… um… we live together but in separate, heterosexual bedrooms.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, okay, well, guess I’m your new neighbour, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Leonard, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi. Well, uh, oh, welcome to the building.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thankyou, maybe we can have coffee sometime.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. Well, bye.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Should we have invited her for lunch?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. We’re going to start Season Two of Battlestar Galactica.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We already watched the Season Two DVDs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not with commentary.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think we should be good neighbours, invite her over, make her feel welcome.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We never invited Louis-slash-Louise over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, then that was wrong of us. We need to widen our circle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have a very wide circle. I have 212 friends on myspace.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, and you’ve never met one of them.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s the beauty of it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going to invite her over. We’ll have a nice meal and chat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Chat? We don’t chat. At least not offline.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well it’s not difficult, you just listen to what she says and then you say something appropriate in response.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To what end?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi. Again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anyway, um. We brought home Indian food. And, um. I know that moving can be stressful, and I find that when I’m undergoing stress, that good food and company can have a comforting effect. Also, curry is a natural laxative, and I don’t have to tell you that, uh, a clean colon is just one less thing to worry about.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I’m not expert here but I believe in the context of a luncheon invitation, you might want to skip the reference to bowel movements.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you’re inviting me over to eat?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s so nice, I’d love to.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, what do you guys do for fun around here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, today we tried masturbating for money.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, make yourself at home.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, thankyou.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re very welcome.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This looks like some serious stuff, Leonard, did you do this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually that’s my work.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it’s just some quantum mechanics, with a little string theory doodling around the edges. That part there, that’s just a joke, it’s a spoof of the Bourne-Oppenheimer approximation.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So you’re like, one of those, beautiful mind genius guys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This is really impressive.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I have a board. If you like boards, this is my board.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Holy smokes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If by holy smokes you mean a derivative restatement of the kind of stuff you can find scribbled on the wall of any men’s room at MIT, sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Who hasn’t seen this differential below “here I sit broken hearted?”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: At least I didn’t have to invent twenty-six dimensions just to make the math come out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t invent them, they’re there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: In what universe?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In all of them, that is the point.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, do you guys mind if I start?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um, Penny, that’s where I sit.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, sit next to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I sit there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In the winter that seat is close enough to the radiator to remain warm, and yet not so close as to cause perspiration. In the summer it’s directly in the path of a cross breeze created by open windows there, and there. It faces the television at an angle that is neither direct, thus discouraging conversation, nor so far wide to create a parallax distortion, I could go on, but I think I’ve made my point.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you want me to move?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just sit somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, sit!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aaah!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well this is nice. We don’t have a lot of company over.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not true. Koothrapali and Wolowitz come over all the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes I now, but…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Tuesday night we played Klingon boggle until one in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, I remember.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I resent you saying we don’t have company.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is an antisocial implication.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I said I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, Klingon boggle?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s like regular boggle but, in Klingon. That’s probably enough about us, tell us about you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, me, okay, I’m Sagittarius, which probably tells you way more than you need to know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, it tells us that you participate in the mass cultural delusion that the Sun’s apparent position relative to arbitrarily defined constellations and the time of your birth somehow effects your personality.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Participate in the what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think what Sheldon’s trying to say, is that Sagittarius wouldn’t have been our first guess.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, a lot of people think I’m a water sign. Okay, let’s see, what else, oh, I’m a vegetarian, oh, except for fish, and the occasional steak, I love steak.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s interesting. Leonard can’t process corn.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wu-uh, do you have some sort of a job?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I’m a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, okay. I love cheesecake.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re lactose intolerant.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t eat it, I just think it’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, anyways, I’m also writing a screenplay. It’s about this sensitive girl who comes to L.A. from Lincoln Nebraska to be an actress, and winds up a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So it’s based on your life?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I’m from Omaha.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, if that was a movie I would go see it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know, right? Okay, let’s see, what else? Um, that’s about it. That’s the story of Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well it sounds wonderful.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It was. Until I fell in love with a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (mouths)
utterance.content: What’s happening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (mouths back)
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh God, you know, four years I lived with him, four years, that’s like as long as High School.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It took you four years to get through High School?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I just, I can’t believe I trusted him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Should I say something? I feel like I should say something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You? No, you’ll only make it worse.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You want to know the most pathetic part? Even though I hate his lying, cheating guts, I still love him. Is that crazy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s not crazy it’s, uh, uh, it’s a paradox. And paradoxes are part of nature, think about light. Now if you look at Huygens, light is a wave, as confirmed by the double slit experiments, but then, along comes Albert Einstein and discovers that light behaves like particles too. Well, I didn’t make it worse.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so sorry, I’m such a mess, and on top of everything else I’m all gross from moving and my stupid shower doesn’t even work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Our shower works.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Would it be totally weird if I used it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s right down the hall.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks. You guys are really sweet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well this is an interesting development.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It has been some time since we’ve had a woman take her clothes off in our apartment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not true, remember at Thanksgiving my grandmother with Alzheimer’s had that episode.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Point taken. It has been some time since we’ve had a woman take her clothes off after which we didn’t want to rip our eyes out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The worst part was watching her carve that turkey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, what exactly are you trying to accomplish here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That woman in there’s not going to have sex with you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well I’m not trying to have sex with her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good. Then you won’t be disappointed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What makes you think she wouldn’t have sex with me, I’m a male and she’s a female?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but not of the same species.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not going to engage in hypotheticals here, I’m just trying to be a good neighbour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not to say that if a carnal relationship were to develop that I wouldn’t participate. However briefly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you think this possibility will be helped or hindered when she discovers your Luke Skywalker no-more-tears shampoo?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s Darth Vader shampoo. Luke Skywalker’s the conditioner.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait till you see this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s fantastic. Unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s a Stephen Hawking lecture from MIT in 1974.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is not a good time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s before he became a creepy computer voice:.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s great, you guys have to go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s just not a good time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard has a lady over.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, right, your grandmother back in town?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. And she’s not a lady, she’s just a new neighbour.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on, there really is a lady here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And you want us out because you’re anticipating coitus?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not anticipating coitus.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So she’s available for coitus?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can we please stop saying coitus?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Technically that would be coitus interruptus.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, is there a trick to getting it to switch from tub to shower. Oh. Hi, sorry. Hello!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Enchante Madamoiselle. Howard Wolowitz, Cal-Tech department of Applied Physics. You may be familiar with some of my work, it’s currently orbiting Jupiter’s largest moon taking high-resolution digital photographs.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Penny. I work at the Cheesecake Factory.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, I’ll show you the trick with the shower.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bon douche.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s French for good shower. It’s a sentiment I can express in six languages.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Save it for your blog, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: See-ka-tong-guay-jow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, there it goes, it sticks, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re welcome, oh, you’re going to step right, okay, I’ll….

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The hair products are Sheldon’s.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, okay. Can I ask you a favour.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A favour? Sure, you can ask me a favour, I would do you a favour for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s okay if you say no.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll probably say yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s just not the kind of thing you ask a guy you’ve just met.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I really think we should examine the chain of causality here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Must we?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Event A. A beautiful woman stands naked in our shower. Event B. We drive half way across town to retrieve a television set from the aforementioned woman’s ex-boyfriend. Query, on what plane of existence is there even a semi-rational link between these events?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She asked me to do her a favour, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, yes, well that may be the proximal cause of our journey, but we both know it only exists in contradistinction to the higher level distal cause.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You think with your penis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s a biological impossibility and you didn’t have to come.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, right, yes, I could have stayed behind and watched Wolowitz try to hit on Penny in Russian, Arabic and Farsi. Why can’t she get her own TV.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, you know how it is with break-ups.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No I don’t. And neither do you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wuh, I, I broke up with Joyce Kim.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You did not break up with Joyce Kim, she defected to North Korea.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To mend her broken heart. This situation is much less complicated. There’s some kind of dispute between Penny and her ex-boyfriend as to who gets custody of the TV. She just wanted to avoid having a scene with him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So we get to have a scene with him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, Sheldon, there’s not going to be a scene. There’s two of us and one of him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, the two of us can’t even carry a TV.

utterance.speaker: Penny (to Raj)
utterance.content: So, you guys work with Leonard and Sheldon at the University?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, I’m sorry, do you speak English?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, he speaks English, he just can’t speak to women.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really, why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s kind of a nerd. Juice box?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (pushes buzzer)
utterance.content: I’ll do the talking.

utterance.speaker: Voice from buzzer
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Leonard, this is Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did I just…. Uh, we’re here to pick up Penny’s TV.

utterance.speaker: Voice
utterance.content: Get lost.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, thanks for your time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not going to give up just like that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, the TV is in the building, we’ve been denied access to the building, ergo we are done.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me, if I were to give up at the first little hitch I never would have been able to identify the fingerprints of string theory in the aftermath of the big bang.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My apologies. What’s your plan.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s just a privilege to watch your mind at work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, we have a combined IQ of 360, we should be able to figure out how to get into a stupid building.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do you think their combined IQ is?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just grab the door.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is it. I’ll do the talking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good thinking, I’ll just be the muscle.

utterance.speaker: Enormous man
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m Leonard, this is Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: From the intercom.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: How the hell did you get in the building?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. We’re scientists.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Tell him about our IQ.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My mom bought me those pants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re going to have to call her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m so sorry I dragged you through this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s okay. It wasn’t my first pantsing, and it won’t be my last.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you were right about my motives, I was hoping to establish a relationship with Penny that might have some day led to sex.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well you got me out of my pants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anyway, I’ve learned my lesson. She’s out of my league, I’m done with her, I’ve got my work, one day I’ll win the Nobel Prize and then I’ll die alone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t think like that, you’re not going to die alone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you Sheldon, you’re a good friend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you’re certainly not going to win a Nobel Prize.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This is one of my favourite places to kick back after a quest, they have a great house ale.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, cool tiger.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve had him since level ten. His name is Buttons. Anyway, if you had your own game character we could hang out, maybe go on a quest.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, sounds interesting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So you’ll think about it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t think I’ll be able to stop thinking about it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Smooth.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re home.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, your ex-boyfriend sends his regards and I think the rest is fairly self-explanatory.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m so sorry, I really thought if you guys went instead of me he wouldn’t be such an ass.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it was a valid hypothesis.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That was a valid hypothesis? What is happening to you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really, thank you so much for going and trying you’re, uh, you’re so terrific. Why don’t you put some clothes on, I’ll get my purse and dinner is on me, okay?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. You’re not done with her, are you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Our babies will be smart and beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not to mention imaginary.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is Thai food okay with you Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We can’t have Thai food, we had Indian for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They’re both curry based cuisines.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They would be gastronomically redundant. I can see we’re going to have to spell out everything for this girl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Any ideas Raj?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Turn left on Lake Street and head up to Colorado. I know a wonderful little sushi bar that has karaoke.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That sounds like fun.

utterance.speaker: Howard (sings)
utterance.content: Baby, baby don’t get hooked on me. Uh, baby, baby don’t get hooked on me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know what your odds are in the world as a whole, but as far as the population of this car goes, you’re a veritable Mack Daddy.
